channel.title: Comments on: Free Tickets to Web2Expo Berlin

item.title: By: Free Ticket for Web2 Expo Berlin available | Electric Mill
item.dc:creator: Free Ticket for Web2 Expo Berlin available | Electric Mill
item.description: [...] Web2Ireland recently had competition with the prize as free tickets to Web2Expo Berlin. With a small skunkworks project that we’re currently undertaking, we managed to extract a couple of tickets. The event is on from 5th-8th November, full details here. [...]
item.content:encoded: [...] Web2Ireland recently had competition with the prize as free tickets to Web2Expo Berlin. With a small skunkworks project that we’re currently undertaking, we managed to extract a couple of tickets. The event is on from 5th-8th November, full details here. [...]

item.title: By: Conor O'Neill
item.dc:creator: Conor O'Neill
item.description:
Hey Will. It's not the idea of an Irish Facebook that's the problem, I was pointing out that it's not a sufficient suggestion. More detail would be required.
Feel free to suggest DiasporaBook by email. I'd check out Geni first tho. We use it in our family and it is currently on a valuation of $100m.
item.content:encoded:
Hey Will. It’s not the idea of an Irish Facebook that’s the problem, I was pointing out that it’s not a sufficient suggestion. More detail would be required.

Feel free to suggest DiasporaBook by email. I’d check out Geni first tho. We use it in our family and it is currently on a valuation of $100m.

item.title: By: Will
item.dc:creator: Will
item.description:
Why would an "Irish Facebook" be a bad idea. Of course it needs a twist...
DisporaBook. Same idea, but you don't link as such... You create a family tree. And go down the paths/branches of the tree, joining with other trees along the way. you finally get to find out who your third cousin 4 times removed is. Find out that your great great great great grandfather on your mothers side is related to the great great great great grandmother of your next door neighbour.
Would it qualify if it was entered?
item.content:encoded:
Why would an “Irish Facebook” be a bad idea. Of course it needs a twist…

DisporaBook. Same idea, but you don’t link as such… You create a family tree. And go down the paths/branches of the tree, joining with other trees along the way.
you finally get to find out who your third cousin 4 times removed is. Find out that your great great great great grandfather on your mothers side is related to the great great great great grandmother of your next door neighbour.

Would it qualify if it was entered?
